section.title: Building Your System Distribution
section.para: Now that you have defined your system distribution, use the systembuilder command to build it. The build process sends output to the screen and to a log file.

section.title: Executing the systembuilder command
section.para: The basic systembuilder command validates the system definition file syntax, resolves package dependencies, creates distribution-specific packages, creates a distribution package repository, and creates deployment images, all while recording process results. The default level of screen output includes errors, build and module status and file download and creation status. SystemBuilder also sends this output to /var/log/systembuilder.log. If a critical error occurs, SystemBuilder includes that information in the log file. To run your build, enter the command below:

#systembuilder samber-server.xml The output for an initial run details all the steps for downloading packages, checking package dependencies and creating images. If there are any errors, SystemBuilder notes those and, in many cases, halts the process. See Appendix A for an example of a successful first-build output.
